About me

Hey there, my name is Ryan and Iâ€™m a Software Engineer/Game Developer! I love working on products that deliver impactful results to a user. I studied Computer Engineering at the University of Arkansas and now I live in Kansas City working for a health tech company. I'm a perpetual learner always looking to better myself and my code. I believe life is too short for stagnation and that we should always look to push the boundaries of what's possible.

Skills

CODE

I've developed projects in a variety of languages like Java, C#, C++, Javascript, and Ruby. My skills and experiences are diverse enough that I can pick up any tech stack and be a valuable contributor to your project.

TOOLS

A developer needs tools and I've used them to build games, automate builds, and contribute to multi-person projects. Some of note are Unity, Jenkins, Chef, and Github.

KNOWLEDGE

I live to learn. Developing myself to learn more than the basic requirements of the job is integral to my success. I have the maturity and knowledge to independently tackle a problem without using outside advice as a crutch.

Around the Web

About Ryan Cullum

I'm a Software Engineer, Game Developer, and life long learner.

© Ryan Cullum 2018

Third Person Zombie Prototype

A round based shooter prototype designed with Unreal and Blueprints for the objective of learning the Unreal engine. The prototype has an inventory system, random enemy spawns, and AI implemented with a simple Nav Mesh Bounds Volume.

  • Category: Design
  • Date: February 2018

Mega Action Shooter

A top-down 2D shooter prototype developed in Unity. The player is faced with multiple enemy types with the ability to use a range of different weapons. Every weapon fires a unique projectile, but the main logic is all inherited from one base class. There are three enemy types each with their own unique health level. AI is configured via a third party plugin called A* Pathfinding Project. The prototype contains three differently designed levels. All programming is done in C# and art is from opengameart.org.

  • Category: Design
  • Date: February 2018

Fallen King

This is a mobile 2D Platformer made in Unity where enemy and obstacle avoidance is crucial. The game includes different enemy patrol patterns and a item collection system written in C#. There are five stages of increasing difficulty and the ability to come back to a level if you decide to take a break. The game is programmed all by myself using art downloaded from opengameart.org. ~

  • Category: Design
  • Date: February 2018
